resources.string: These 100% Pinot Noir grapes are meticulously hand-sorted. Each lot is fermented in small batches with up to 20% whole cluster inclusion. Stainless steel fermentation with daily punch downs and pump overs is followed by malolactic fermentation.

For optimum flavor and body, this wine underwent delestage, with extended maceration before being aged in 25% new French oak. The varietals blended for the 2017 NEXT Red Blend are 40% Syrah, 40% Merlot, 20% Cabernet Sauvignon.
Cold soaked for 48 hours with daily pump overs. Fermented in a stainless steel open top tank with twice daily punch downs. Aged 17 months in 22% new French oak.

2014 Walla Walla Cabernet Sauvignon was cold soaked, punched down and pumped over throughout fermentation. Delestage, a process to oxygenate or aerate the wine and soften the tannins, was performed midway through fermentation.

The 2016 Brut Cuvée was four years in the making. Brut Cuvée literally means a dry blend that uses the first pressed and most desirable grape juice. Our Brut Cuvée is a blend of Pinot Noir (83%) and Chardonnay (17%) made in the traditional "méthode champenoise."
The 2018 vintage was fermented in 100% stainless steel tanks, which were temperature controlled to maximize fruit character. This wine benefited from sur lie aging for 4 months prior to bottling.
This 2012 Riesling was handpicked, and whole cluster pressed before being cold-settled, racked, and slowly fermented. This wine benefited from sur lie aging for 4 months prior to bottling.

This wine was made using the méthode champenoise (“champagne method”), the traditional method from the Champagne region in France distinguished by subjecting the wine to a second fermentation en tirage, or in the bottle.

The fruit was whole cluster pressed and cool fermented in stainless steel with some varieties co-fermenting. One lot was Biodynamically allowed to ferment with native yeast. Sur lie aged for six months in stainless steel tanks.
